intro: Cleistocalyx fullagarii, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of eastern Australia, particularly Queensland. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. These flowers are usually clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, giving the plant its common name. It is a shrub that thrives in sandy or limestone soils and is often found in coastal heathlands.
